title: US may deport international students whose universities switch to online-only learning
description: International students who are pursuing degrees in the United States will have to leave the country or risk deportation if their universities switch to online-only courses, Immigration and Customs Enforcement announced Monday.

title: White House defends Trump's tweet about Black NASCAR driver
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar and Kaitlan Collins discuss a Tweet made by President Trump about Nascar driver Bubba Wallace, and how White House press secretary Kayleigh McEnany attempted to explain it during a White House briefing.

title: The US is in a 'free fall' with coronavirus, doctors warn
description:
• Analysis: Trump is forcing the GOP to make a big choice 
• CNN's Dana Bash presses senator: You criticized Obama for this in 2014

title: White woman who called police on Black birdwatcher in Central Park charged
description: The woman who was caught on video accusing a Central Park birdwatcher of threatening her will be prosecuted, the Manhattan district attorney said Monday.

title: Statue of Frederick Douglass toppled on anniversary of his famous speech
description: There's only a stump where a statue of famed abolitionist Frederick Douglass once stood.

title: Australia to seal off 6.6 million people in virus-hit state as outbreak worsens
The decision that will haunt Trump's reelection bid
description: As coronavirus cases surge and governors begin agitating for a national mandate on wearing masks, President Donald Trump is showing few signs he'll budge on an issue that has come to epitomize a national pandemic response rooted in denial and which now threatens his political future.

title: Mystery fire at Iranian nuclear facility is the latest in a series of unexplained incidents
description: It is the world's most scrutinized shed. Exactly what happened to an outer building at an Iranian nuclear facility means both everything and nothing, as Tehran grapples with protecting its regional clout during the twin ravages of the coronavirus and US sanctions.

title: White House refuses to denounce Confederate flag
description: President Donald Trump on Monday bemoaned NASCAR's recent decision to ban the Confederate flag from all races and events.

title: Facebook and others halt user data sharing with Hong Kong authorities for now
description: Facebook and its messaging service WhatsApp will stop processing requests for user data made by Hong Kong law enforcement authorities while they carry out an assessment of a controversial security law imposed by China on the city.

title: Country music star Charlie Daniels, best known for 'The Devil Went Down to Georgia,' has died
description: Country music scribe Charlie Daniels, best known for the hit "Devil Went Down to Georgia," has died. He was 83.

title: Fox News cropped Trump out of photo with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, then called it a mistake
description: Fox News said on Monday that it "mistakenly" cropped President Trump out of a photograph that featured the accused sex-trafficker Jeffrey Epstein and his alleged accomplice Ghislaine Maxwell.

title: Explosive Trump tell-all book by his niece to be released early
description: A tell-all book by President Trump's niece Mary, a licensed clinical psychologist, will now be published next week, two weeks earlier than expected, the publisher Simon & Schuster said Monday.

title: Meet the 'tiny bug slayer,' an ancient relative of giant dinosaurs
description: A "tiny bug slayer" that only reached 4 inches in height was the ancestor of much larger dinosaurs and flying pterosaurs 237 million years ago, according to a new study.

title: How one diver became the 'shark whisperer'
description: Cristina Zenato needs only two words to describe sharks—nature's masterpiece. A professional diver in the Bahamas, she loves sharks. Especially the Caribbean reef sharks that flourish around Grand Bahama Island, thanks in large part to her efforts to protect them. The sharks swim right up to the woman known as the "shark whisperer" and nuzzle against her while she pets them like they're dogs or cats. Great Big Story takes a dive off Grand Bahama Island with Zenato to learn how she built such a strong bond with these beautiful creatures.

title: Mexico's president has his own plane. So why is he flying commercial to meet Trump?
description: If you happen to be flying between Mexico City and Washington, DC, this week, you could be seatmates with a president.

title: Russian goalkeeper, 16, suffers severe burns after struck by lightning
description: The video is grainy, but with the help of a spotlight, the moment a Russian footballer is struck by a bolt of lightning is clearly visible.

title: White House chief of staff repeats Trump's baseless claim
description: White House chief of staff Mark Meadows on Monday reiterated President Donald Trump's baseless claim that 99% of coronavirus cases are "totally harmless."

title: Record-breaking rainfall triggers deadly floods in Japan
description: Dozens of people were left dead or missing on the southern island of Kyushu after record-breaking rainfall triggered deadly flash floods and landslides.

title: This glacier is turning pink, and that's bad news
description: A glacier in Italy is turning pink because of algae -- a development that will make the ice melt faster, a scientist studying the phenomenon says.

title: Italian Alps experiencing pink snow
description: Scientists are studying the climate impact of the spread of algae that is turning snow pink in the Italian Alps.

title: The US is in a 'free fall' with Covid-19, doctors warn
US Supreme Court says states can punish Electoral College voters
description: The Supreme Court said Monday that states can punish members of the Electoral College who fail to fulfill a pledge to vote for a state's popular vote winner in presidential elections.

title: Elon Musk sells short shorts in jab at investors
description: Tesla is having a great year. Its stock is up 200% in 2020, its market value now exceeds every other carmaker on the planet, as well as Disney and Coke. CEO Elon Musk may truly have proved Tesla's haters wrong.

title: Your security camera may be telling burglars when you're not home
description: Some popular home security cameras could allow would-be burglars to work out when you've left the building, according to a study published Monday.

title: Struggling airline swaps planes for trains
description: Austria's flagship airline is replacing one of its flights with a more frequent train service, in order to meet the environmental criteria of its recent government bailout.

title: Herd immunity to Covid-19 may be 'unachievable', large-scale study indicates
description: Spain's large-scale study on the coronavirus indicates just 5% of its population has developed antibodies, strengthening evidence that a so-called herd immunity to Covid-19 is "unachievable," the medical journal the Lancet reported on Monday.

title: 'Wear the damn mask,' Matthew McConaughey tells America
description: Matthew McConaughey got straight to the point in a new video posted on social media over the weekend.

title: Prince Harry and Meghan say the UK must reckon with its colonial past and 'right those wrongs'
description: Prince Harry and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, have encouraged Britain to reckon with its colonial past, highlighting the "wrongs" of its historic involvement in the countries that now make up the Commonwealth.

title: Vogue Portugal drops widely slammed 'madness' cover depicting woman in a psychiatric hospital
description: Vogue Portugal has dropped one of the front covers of its July / August issue, after it was widely slammed online.

title: Efforts to beat coronavirus pandemic could cause over 1 million extra deaths from other diseases, experts warn
description: As health services around the world continue to focus their resources on ending the coronavirus pandemic, they threaten to derail decades of hard-won progress in the response to HIV, TB and many other diseases. That's according to a new report by the International AIDS Society publishing this week.

title: Agencies seem to be afraid to talk about virus being airborne, expert says
description: Imagine a noisy, crowded bar. Music is pounding, and people are clustered close together, talking loudly or even shouting to be heard. If it's cold out, doors and windows are shut tight and the heat is on, or if it's hot out, everything is shut and the air conditioner is recirculating the air.

title: Facebook and WhatsApp won't give Hong Kong authorities user data for now
Mona Lisa is back but without the crowds as the Louvre reopens
description: The world's most popular museum, the Louvre, has reopened its doors after months of closure, but while visiting it will now be a slightly different experience, its star attraction should at least be free of crowds.

title: The bubonic plague is back again
description: Authorities in the Chinese region of Inner Mongolia are on high alert after a suspected case of bubonic plague, the disease that caused the Black Death pandemic, was reported Sunday.

title: Dalai Lama marks his 85th birthday with his first ever album release
description: The 14th Dalai Lama is marking his 85th birthday by releasing his first ever album.

title: Australia to seal off 6.6 million people in virus-hit state
description: Australia will isolate 6.6 million people in the state of Victoria from the rest of the nation at 11.59 p.m. on Tuesday, as authorities take drastic action to control a coronavirus outbreak in the city of Melbourne.

title: Everyday words and phrases that have racist connotations
description: The words and phrases permeate nearly every aspect of our society.

title: What it's like to visit a country that doesn't exist
description: For various complicated reasons, a number of self-declared countries around the world aren't officially recognized -- some are even left off maps. Brazilian author Guilherme Canever has been to many of them and documented his adventures in a new book.

title: This country is bucking Latin America's virus trend, here's how
description: Uruguay has been successfully managing its coronavirus outbreak, an outlier in a region that is being badly hit by the pandemic. CNN's Patrick Oppmann reports.

title: How this budget airline could weather the pandemic storm
description: For more than two months, airport terminals in South Africa sat eerily silent. As the spread of coronavirus crippled demand for air travel across the globe, the country enacted one of the world's strictest lockdowns on March 27, effectively banning all commercial passenger flights.

title: Tensions heat up in South China Sea as US makes significant show of force
description: For the first time in six years, two US Navy aircraft carriers are in the South China Sea, the latest show of military might from Washington as it pushes back against China's sweeping claim to much of the contested region.

title: TikTok risks losing its biggest market
description: India is TikTok's top market for new downloads, and parent-company ByteDance had forecast $1 billion in advertising revenue there this year. Now India's ban on Chinese apps has put TikTok's fate in jeopardy in one of the fastest-growing markets in the world. CNN's Sherisse Pham reports.

title: These senior Indian couples found love again. Not everyone is happy about it
description: Evening is Asawari Kulkarni's favorite time of the day. She spends it sipping green tea with her new partner Anil Yardi.
